results.title: One trick pony
results.creator_credit: Robert Young, Michael Tannen, Michael Hausman and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Paul Simon used his own knowledge and experience of the rock music industry in writing the script to “One Trick Pony”. He plays Jonah Levin, a one-time successful musician who is approaching middle-age and is increasingly seen as a has-been by the business people who run the industry. His wife (Blair Brown) is frustrated with Jonah’s continual life on the road and wants him to begin to take up the responsibilities that come with marriage and age. Simon wrote the music and songs for this film which forms a musical counterpart to the narrative. As much as it is about music and performance, the film is also an examination of what happened to the ideals and hopes of the hippie generation once it aged. Cast also includes Rip Torn, Joan Hackett and Lou Reed and features cameo appearances by Tiny Tim, soul legends Sam and Dave, the Lovin’ Spoonful and the B-52s.

results.title: Playing for keeps
results.creator_credit: Harvey Weinstein, Bob Weinstein, Alan Brewer, Playing for Keeps and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: On graduating from high school friends Spike, Danny, Silk and Tracy are eager to make their mark on life but are concerned at their lack of suitable job prospects. When Danny discovers he has inherited the Majestic Hotel for the cost of $8000, he takes his friends and makes the move from the city to the country. With town planners on their back with a hidden agenda for a proposed chemical “preprocessing” plant and hostile townsfolk, it becomes a test of stamina to endure the persecution as well as continue the hard work required to renovate the dilapidated motel. Cast includes Daniel Jordano, Matthew Penn, Leon W. Grant, Mary B. Ward and Marisa Tomei.

results.title: City girl
results.brief_description: Anne (Laura Harrington) is a photographer trying to advance her career taking snaps of high profile people in compromising situations. While working on a futuristic fashion shoot, she makes friends with two of the models, Gracie and Sugar, who also happen to dabble in prostitution on the side. Gracie particularly catches Anne’s interest when it is revealed that she has been in a relationship with Champagne Sam, one of the city’s most notorious pimps. Anne soon breaks up with her boyfriend, Joey (Joe Mastroianni), and starts leading the high life, frequenting strip clubs with her friends, and pursuing unsatisfactory relationships with a number of different men. However, Anne’s new-found freedom comes at a price; her latest photographic assignment turns into a nightmare when Champagne Sam, whom she was secretly photographing for an assignment, discovers that she has been hiding Gracie, and ransacks her apartment. Suddenly Anne realises how close she has come to total disaster. But has she realised too late?

results.title: Honky Tonk freeway
results.creator_credit: John Schlesinger, Howard W. Koch, Don Boyd, Universal Pictures and AFD
results.brief_description: When a new freeway is built that bypasses the tiny but thriving Florida town of Ticlaw, depriving it of the livelihood it garners from passing motorists, the mayor and other oddball citizens of the town dream up hair-brained schemes as a lure to the tourist trade. The film follows a group of equally eccentric range of travellers who inadvertently find themselves in Ticlaw—a place they never intended to visit. Cast includes Beau Bridges, Hume Cronyn, Beverly D’Angelo, William Devane, Teri Garr and Geraldine Page.

results.title: She's having a baby
results.brief_description:
John Hughes’ romantic comedy of yuppie angst stars Kevin Bacon and Elizabeth McGovern as Jake and Kristi Briggs. Jake, after falling in love with Kristi at first sight, is beginning to have second thoughts about ending his single life as he is walking down the aisle on their wedding day. A year later their dreams of a perfect life in a perfect house have turned into a series of hilarious marital nightmares. Kristi has just received news that really ought to make things interesting - she’s pregnant.
Cast also includes: Alec Baldwin, Lili Taylor

results.title: Swing shift
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Demme, Jerry Bick, Warner Bros Pictures and Lantana
results.brief_description: Goldie Hawn and Kurt Russell star in this vivid look back at the wartime conditions that stood society on its head - and a sensitive, romantic story of the good times and the bad times a whole generation of Americans will never forget. The movie stays at home and follows the stories of men and women working in the factories that produce weaponry for the battles overseas, all produced predominantly by the round-the-clock efforts of over 3 million female workers. Many, like Hawn’s character Kay Walsh, have never held a wrench before - but you’re never too pretty to learn. Christine Lahti, co-starring as Kay’s sultry neighbour, Hazel, proves that even a dance-hall singer can handle a rivet gun. Russell plays Lucky Lockhart, the 4-F classified trumpet player who’d rather be handling real guns - until he falls in love with Kay. Kays’ husband Jack (Ed Harris) comes home on leave and finds out that his wife has betrayed him. Lucky then decides to pursue Hazel, driving a wedge between the two friends.

results.title: The In crowd
results.creator_credit: Mark Rosenthal, Lawrence Konner, Keith Rubinstein, Orion Pictures Corporation and Force Ten
results.brief_description: Its 1965, and rock’n’roll has ricocheted around the world. Nowhere is the music more popular than Philadelphia, where smooth-talking Perry Parker (Joe Pantoliano) hosts the city’s hottest TV show “Dance Party”. The dancing fever has also infected the suburbs where Del Green (Donovan Leitch), a high school senior, spends most of his time spinning, twisting and daydreaming of Vicky (Jennifer Runyon), “Dance Party’s” reigning teen goddess. On a dare Del foregoes his college entrance exam, auditions for the show, is chosen and becomes an instant success. Del and Vicky become “Dance Party’s” hottest new couple. To the beat of 60s rock’n’roll, and against a steamy backdrop of fancy footwork and raw competition, their make-believe romance becomes a doomed off-stage love affair.

results.title: Illegally yours
results.creator_credit: Peter Bogdanovich, United Artists Corporation, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, De Laurentiis Entertainment Group and Crescent Moon
results.brief_description: This is the off-beat story of Richard Dice (Rob Lowe), a college dropout who comes back home only to find himself on jury duty in the trial of his high school-sweetheart, Molly (Colleen Camp), who is charged with murder. Convinced she’s been framed, he sets out to prove her innocence - only things don’t go according to plan when he finds himself the target of a band of crazy thugs; shady conspirators; millionaires; jurors; judges and the police. But really, what’s a little perjury, blackmail, burglary and murder among friends.

results.title: Moving in = Firstborn
results.creator_credit: Michael Apted, Ron Koslow, Tony Thomas, Paul Junger Witt, Thomas Productions, Witt, Jaffe-Lansing Productions and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: A story of relationships, love, loyalty and family - and intruders who upset the balance. Wendy (Teri Garr) is a young divorced mother with two sons, Jake (Christopher Collet) and Brian (Corey Haim). Mother and sons appear to cope reasonably well in their relationships towards one another with the usual generational disagreements and ups and downs all families face at one time or another. However, when Sam (Peter Weller) enters into Wendy’s life, the boys find themselves gradually being pushed aside as their mother’s interest in Sam turns increasingly to love. When Sam moves in, both Jake and Brian become suspicious of his motives and eventually it is up to Jake, as first born, to try and take control of a situation that is rapidly getting out of hand. Both boys are determined to protect their mother at all costs but for Jake it is a moment of confrontation and making choices. Contains some violent scenes. Cast also includes a very young Sarah Jessica Parker as Jake’s girlfriend, Lisa and Robert Downey Jr (also in his teens) as one of Jake’s friends, Lee.

results.title: Forever, Lulu
results.creator_credit: Amos Kollek, Tri-Star Pictures and Lulu Productions
results.brief_description: In this comedy in the vein of “Desperately seeking Susan” a young German woman (Hanna Schygulla), struggling to survive in New York City, dreams of becoming a novelist. One day, broke, lonely and on the street she stumbles across a photograph of a beautiful blond named Lulu (Debbie Harry) and decides to track her down. Instantly, both her luck and her life take a dramatic new direction. Her madcap quest leads her into a real-life gangster mystery involving drugs and murder that just might bring her the fame and fortune she craves.
